intro: Leptochloa loliiformis, commonly known as the slender oatgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, two-lobed flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. Leptochloa loliiformis is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
